intro: Eleocharis amphibia, commonly known as the water needlegrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wetland environments, such as marshes and shallow waters. The plant has slender, grass-like stems and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. Its rhizomes allow it to spread vegetatively, contributing to its ability to colonize moist soils. Eleocharis amphibia plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
